value: Connecting Asia Through the Work of Viktor Tsoi
ヴィクトルツォイを通して築くアジアのつながり
Kyushu University, Ohashi Campus, Design Commons
九州大学 大橋キャンパス デザインコモンズ

Join us for a screening of The Needle, with the presence of its director, Rachid Nougmanov. The event will also have lectures about the connections among Viktor Tsoi, Kino, and Asia, and will have very special international guests, who will participate in round tables with the audience.

[JP Join us for a screening of The Needle, with the presence of its director, Rachid Nougmanov. The event will also have lectures about the connections among Viktor Tsoi, Kino, and Asia, and will have very special international guests, who will participate in round tables with the audience.]

Viktor Tsoi: Connecting Russia, Japan, Korea, and Brazil
[JP Viktor Tsoi:] [JP Connecting Russia, Japan, Korea, and Brazil]
Director of The Needle. A Kazakh film director, screenwriter, and producer. A pioneer of Kazakh new wave cinema, he connects Central Asian narratives with global audiences.
[JP Director of The Needle. A Kazakh film director, screenwriter, and producer. A pioneer of Kazakh new wave cinema, he connects Central Asian narratives with global audiences.]

Producer at Amuse Inc. and founder of Little Magic Films, develops internationally acclaimed projects that bridge Japanese cinema with global audiences, fostering cross-cultural storytelling and innovative film collaborations.

[JP Producer at Amuse Inc. and founder of Little Magic Films, develops internationally acclaimed projects that bridge Japanese cinema with global audiences, fostering cross-cultural storytelling and innovative film collaborations.]

American singer, producer, and writer who introduced Soviet rock to Western audiences, building cultural exchange through music and art between the United States, Russia, and Japan since the 1980s. Joanna will be joining us online.

[JP American singer, producer, and writer who introduced Soviet rock to Western audiences, building cultural exchange through music and art between the United States, Russia, and Japan since the 1980s. Joanna will be joining us online.]

Professor at the Faculty of Humanities, Department of Language and Literature, Kyushu University. Her research involves well-being through the arts, exploring how creative practices enhance mental health and cross-cultural understanding.

[JP Professor at the Faculty of Humanities, Department of Language and Literature, Kyushu University. Her research involves well-being through the arts, exploring how creative practices enhance mental health and cross-cultural understanding.]
Writer and Professor of Korean culture and Literature at the University of Ljubljana. Known for his literary work bridging Viktor Tsoi and Korean identity.
[JP Writer and Professor of Korean culture and Literature at the University of Ljubljana. Known for his literary work bridging Viktor Tsoi and Korean identity.]

Assistant Professor at the Institute for Asian and Oceanian Studies at Kyushu University. Her background is in art and design, however, her interests permeate cultural and social factors, leading to her research into cultural expression in different countries.

[JP Assistant Professor at the Institute for Asian and Oceanian Studies at Kyushu University. Her background is in art and design, however, her interests permeate cultural and social factors, leading to her research into cultural expression in different countries.]
Lecturer in Russian literature, underground art, and culture at Chuo Gakuin University, having previously lectured on NHK's Advanced Russian programmes.
[JP Lecturer in Russian literature, underground art, and culture at Chuo Gakuin University, having previously lectured on NHK's Advanced Russian programmes.]
